title: Predicting the motion of the COM

content.question: Two spheres of mass <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="2 M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> float in space in the absence of external gravitational forces, as shown in the figure. Which of the following predictions is correct about the motion of the center of mass of the two-sphere system?

choices.label: The center of mass remains at rest.
The center of mass accelerates toward the sphere of mass <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The center of mass accelerates toward the sphere of mass <math alttext="2 M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The answer cannot be determined without knowing the distance of separation between the center of mass for each sphere.

content.answer: The center of mass remains at rest.
